jlyrics.datatypes
Class SongLyrics

java.lang.Object
  jlyrics.datatypes.SongLyrics

public class SongLyrics
extends java.lang.Object

A class for holding the lyrics of a song, as parsed from a source file or as specified directly as a string. Automatically parses lyrics into words, into lines and into segments (e.g. verses, choruses, etc.), where lines are separated by line breaks and segments are separated by blank lines. Also makes note of all unique words in the song and how often they each occur.

Constructor Detail

SongLyrics

public SongLyrics(java.lang.String identifier,
                  java.lang.String file_path,
                  java.lang.String raw_lyrics)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Manual constructor. Parses the specified raw_lyrics into song lines and song segments.

Parameters:
identifier - A name used internally to refer to the referenced song. Should be unique.
file_path - The path to some file of interest in relation to the lyrics contained in the raw_lyrics parameter. This file is not actually parsed by this constructor, however. May be null if no such file is available. Otherwise, should be unique.
raw_lyrics - The complete lyrics of a song. A value of null indicates that no lyrics are available.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws an informative exception if invalid input is specified.

SongLyrics

public SongLyrics(java.lang.String identifier,
                  java.lang.String file_path)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Parses the specified file in order to acquire raw lyrics, song lines and song segments.

Parameters:
identifier - A name used internally to refer to the referenced song. Should be unique and may not be null.
file_path - The path of the file from which the lyrics contained in an object of this class are to be parsed. Should be unique. May not be null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws an informative exception if invalid input is specified.
Method Detail

getIdentifier

public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
Returns the unique name used internally to refer to the referenced song.

Returns:
The unique identifier.

getFilePath

public java.lang.String getFilePath()
Returns the unique path of a file associated with the lyrics contained in this object. May be null if no such file is available.

Returns:
The unique file path.

isLyricsAvailable

public boolean isLyricsAvailable()
Returns whether or not the lyrics are available for this song. This could be because the song is instrumental, or it could be because they could not be found. This will be true even if only whitespace characters are present, however.

Returns:
Whether or not lyrics are available.

getRawLyrics

public java.lang.String getRawLyrics()
Returns the complete unprocessed lyrics of this song. Will be null if there are no lyrics to return, although it will be non-null even if only whitespace characters are present.

Returns:
The raw lyrics of this song.

getWords

public java.lang.String[] getWords()
Returns the raw lyrics separated out into words. Whitespace characters are removed. Repeated words are not filtered out. Each entry corresponds to an individual word. Null is returned if there are no lyrics.

Returns:
The individual words of this song.

getSongLines

public java.lang.String[] getSongLines()
Returns the lyrics of this song, broken into lines. Lines consisting only of line breaks are filtered out. Will be null if there are no lyrics to return.

Returns:
The lines of this song.

getSongSegments

public java.lang.String[][] getSongSegments()
Returns the lyrics of this song, broken into segments (e.g. verses, choruses, etc.). The first indice refers to the segment and the second to the line. Lines consisting only of line breaks are filtered out. Will be null if there are no lyrics to return.

Returns:
The segments of this song.

getUniqueWords

public java.lang.String[] getUniqueWords()
Returns an array containing all unique words contained in this song (i.e. without duplicates). The order of the words corresponds to the order of the word counts returned by the getUniqueWordCounts method. Null is returned if there are no non-whitespace words in this song.

Returns:
The unique words.

getUniqueWordCounts

public int[] getUniqueWordCounts()
Returns an array containing how many times each word occured in this song. The order of the counts corresponds to the order of the words returned by the getUniqueWords method. Null is returned if there are no non-whitespace words in this song.

Returns:
The unique words.

printContents

public void printContents()
Prints the contents of this object to standard out. Intended for debugging.

parseTextFile

public static java.lang.String parseTextFile(java.lang.String file_path_to_parse)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Parses a text file in order to extract lyrics from it. Simply returns the contents of the file as a string. Returns null if the file is empty, and throws an exception if the file cannot be found or parsed.

Parameters:
file_path_to_parse - The path of the text file to parse.
Returns:
The contents of the text file. Null if it is empty.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws an informative exception if the specified file cannot be found or parsed.

parseWords

public static java.lang.String[] parseWords(java.lang.String lyrics_string)
Finds all of the words in the specified lyrics and returns them separated out into an array with one entry per word. "Words" consisting only of white space are not counted. Returns null if the given string is null or if no words containing content other than whitespace are contained in it.

Parameters:
lyrics_string - The complete unprocessed lyrics of a song.
Returns:
An array with the words in lyrics_string separated out.

parseSongLines

public static java.lang.String[] parseSongLines(java.lang.String lyrics_string)
Parses the specified lyrics into lines, where lines are assumed to be segmented by line breaks. Lines consisting only of line breaks are filtered out. Null is returned if there are no non line break characters in the given lyrics_string or if it is null.

Parameters:
lyrics_string - The complete unprocessed lyrics of a song.
Returns:
The parsed lyrics, with each line in a separate element of the array.

parseSongSegments

public static java.lang.String[][] parseSongSegments(java.lang.String lyrics_string)
Parses the specified lyrics into segments (e.g. verses, choruses, etc.), where segments are assumed to be segmented by blank lines and lines are segmented by line breaks. Lines consisting only of line breaks are filtered out. Null is returned if there are no non line break characters in the given lyrics_string or if it is null.

Parameters:
lyrics_string - The complete unprocessed lyrics of a song.
Returns:
The parsed lyrices, with the first element of the array corresponding to segments and the second corresponding to lines for that segment.

parseUniqueWords

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> parseUniqueWords(java.lang.String lyrics_string)
Finds all of the unique words in the specified lyrics and counts how often they occur. "Words" consisting only of white space are not counted. Returns null if the given string is null or if no words containing content other than whitespace are contained in it.

Parameters:
lyrics_string - The complete unprocessed lyrics of a song.
Returns:
A HashMap that maps all unique words found to the number of times that they occured in the lyrics_string.
